conference.title: ALL-RUSSIAN (WITH INTERNATIONAL PARTICIPATION) CONFERENCE
conference.subtitle: "LOW-TEMPERATURE PLASMA PHYSICS" (LTPP-2026)
conference.dates: The conference will take place from June 1 to 5, 2026 in Kazan
conference.purpose: The goal of the conference is to create conditions for uniting Russian and foreign scientists, engineers, and technologists in solving fundamental and applied problems in the field of low-temperature plasma physics research.
conference.section10: Plasma in medical and biological applications
conference.section11: Plasma dynamics, plasma and ion thrusters
conference.section12: Plasma in material synthesis, including nanomaterials

conference.youngSchoolSubtitle: "Low-Temperature Plasma in Functional Coating Deposition Processes"
conference.youngSchoolGoal: The school aims to develop creative scientific activity of young scientists and provide qualified discussion of the latest research results.
conference.youngSchoolParticipation: Participants have the opportunity to attend plenary and sectional meetings, lectures.

history.title: History
history.subtitle: All-Russian Conference on Low-Temperature Plasma Physics
history.description: The All-Russian Conference (with international participation) on Low-Temperature Plasma Physics is organized under the guidance of the Scientific Council of the Russian Academy of Sciences for Low-Temperature Plasma Physics. It is held every three years. Since 1966, it has been hosted in:
history.periodicity: The conference is held periodically every three years.
history.since2014: Since 2014, the conference has been held in Kazan.
